intro: Draba fladnizensis, commonly known as the Fladnizen’s rockcress, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in Kazakhstan and surrounding areas. This species typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and appear in clusters, often blooming in late spring to early summer. Draba fladnizensis is characterized by its low-growing habit and is often found in high-altitude habitats where few other plants can survive.
